greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Matrix square of triangle A136220, read by rows.
comment: Column 0 of this triangle = column 1 of square array A136217.
formula: Let P=A136220, V=A136230, then column k of P^2 (this triangle) = column 0 of V^(k+1) while column j of V = column 0 of P^(3j+2).
example: Let P = A136220, then this triangle is P^2 and begins:
where column k of P^2 = column 0 of V^(k+1) and
where column k of V = column 0 of P^(3k+2).
where column k of P = column 0 of U^(k+1) and U = A136228.
program: (PARI) {T(n,k)=local(P=Mat(1),U,PShR);if(n>0,for(i=0,n, PShR=matrix(#P,#P, r,c, if(r>=c,if(r==c,1,if(c==1,0,P[r-1,c-1]))));U=P*PShR^2; U=matrix(#P+1, #P+1, r,c, if(r>=c, if(r<#P+1,U[r,c], if(c==1,(P^3)[ #P,1],(P^(3*c-1))[r-c+1,1])))); P=matrix(#U, #U, r,c, if(r>=c, if(r<#R,P[r,c], (U^c)[r-c+1,1])))));(P^2)[n+1,k+1]}
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Jan 28 2008
